docs.snippet: BOSTON, Oct. 14 -- The Post has particulars which leave but little doubt of the total loss of the Boston ship Magellan, with her entire complement of officers and seamen, together with a valuable cargo. The owners of the Magellan, Messrs. Hemenway...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOSTON, Oct. 14 -- The Post has particulars which leave but little doubt of the total loss of the Boston ship Magellan, with her entire complement of officers and seamen, together with a valuable cargo. The owners of the Magellan, Messrs. Hemenway Browne, whose offices are in the New-York Life Insurance Building, on Milk Street, received letters from their agents at Valparaiso to-day, giving full details of the disaster.

headline.main: THE SHIP MAGELLAN LOST; AND THE OFFICERS AND CREW HAVE UNDOUBTEDLY PERISHED.

docs.snippet: LONDON, July 23. -- The Dutch steamer Spaarndam, Capt. Boujer, from New-York, July 12, for Boulogne and Rotterdam, passed the Isle of Wight to-day. She signaled that the National Line steamer Egypt, Capt. Sumner, from New-York, July 10, for Liverp...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 23. -- The Dutch steamer Spaarndam, Capt. Boujer, from New-York, July 12, for Boulogne and Rotterdam, passed the Isle of Wight to-day. She signaled that the National Line steamer Egypt, Capt. Sumner, from New-York, July 10, for Liverpool, had been abandoned on fire at sea, and that her crew were on board the British tank steamer Manhattan, Capt. Robinson, from New-York, July 9, for Hull, and would be landed at Dover.

headline.main: THE EGYPT BURNED AT SEA.; NEWS OF THE LOSS OF ANOTHER NATIONAL LINE STEAMSHIP.

docs.snippet: The clerks in the office of R. G. Dun  Co.'s mercantile agency, 316 Broadway, have for years looked upon Mr. Erastus Wiman as a model of punctuality, and when he failed to reach his desk on time yesterday morning there was no end of comment on the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The clerks in the office of R. G. Dun Co.'s mercantile agency, 316 Broadway, have for years looked upon Mr. Erastus Wiman as a model of punctuality, and when he failed to reach his desk on time yesterday morning there was no end of comment on the unusual incident.

headline.main: WHY MR. WIMAN WAS LATE.; THE FERRYBOAT ROBERT GARRETT MET WITH AN ACCIDENT.

docs.snippet: DESERONTO, Ontario, Oct. 24.--The steamer Quinte of the Deseronto Navigation Company, Capt. Christle in command, was burned about three miles from Deseronto last evening while on her way to Pietou. Four persons were lost. They were Capt. Christie'...
docs.lead_paragraph: DESERONTO, Ontario, Oct. 24.--The steamer Quinte of the Deseronto Navigation Company, Capt. Christle in command, was burned about three miles from Deseronto last evening while on her way to Pietou. Four persons were lost. They were Capt. Christie's mother, his young brother, Charles, Mrs. Stacey, the ladies' maid, and her son, Davern of Trenton.

headline.main: THE STEAMER QUINTE BURNED.; FOUR LIVES LOST AND EIGHT PERSONS BADLY INJURED.

docs.snippet: ATLANTIC CITY, N.J., Sept. 2.--The barkentine Nicanor, Capt. J.H. Wolf, from Montevideo for New-York, stranded on the south bar of the Great Egg Harbor Inlet at 1:30 this morning. The weather was thick and smoky. There was a strong inshore current...
docs.abstract: Nicanor Stranded in Great Egg Harbor
docs.lead_paragraph: ATLANTIC CITY, N.J., Sept. 2.--The barkentine Nicanor, Capt. J.H. Wolf, from Montevideo for New-York, stranded on the south bar of the Great Egg Harbor Inlet at 1:30 this morning. The weather was thick and smoky. There was a strong inshore current, and the ship was considerably out of her course.

headline.main: THE NICANOR ASHORE; NO LIVES LOST BUT FOUR PASSENGERS TERRIBLY FRIGHTENED.

docs.abstract: Normandie Sinks Charlotte Webb During Fog in Harbor; Damage Suit
docs.lead_paragraph: The fog which made navigation difficult and dangerous for three days, and which delayed many vessels entering or passing out of the port, leaves behind it a record which includes three serious collisions, one of them involving the loss of two lives.

headline.main: BRUTAL FRENCH OFFICERS; THEY RUN THE NORMANDIE OVER A PILOT BOAT. TWO SAILORS DROWNED AND THE SURVIVORS HEARTILY CURSED--SEVERAL COLLISIONS IN THE FOG.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Hamburg steamship Suevia arrived at Quarantine last night at about 8 o'clock, and though she brought no news of the missing people from the Danmark she still was the bearer of sad tidings.

headline.main: A PILOT BOAT SUNK.; THE SUEVIA RUNS DOWN THE BATEMAN--TWO MEN DROWNED.
